title: Pentagram-ers?
content:
hi all,

Was wondering if any current Pentagram people are active at typophile?  
I’d like to show someone my work.

thanks much,  
jarrod

 [‹ one typeface, different looks](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39925 "Go to previous forum topic") [a typeface that looks like mostra ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39892 "Go to next forum topic")
author: begsini

comments.content:
Why not sending it directly to Pentagram?

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
 [AL](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.lenart.pl/) [▪](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.lenart.pl/news) [▪](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.lenart.pl/work) [▪](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.lenart.pl/about) [▪](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203843/http:/www.lenart.pl/contact)
I didn’t know there was an Ohio Pentagram office, fredo. ;-)
I didn’t know Ohians weren’t allowed to travel, Ricardo. Is Bush to blame?

No, it’s just cheaper to send an e-mail or an envelope with a resume and some samples before actually travelling long-distance. :-)

You can’t just visit a studio without an appointment...
That’s a lovely colour on a lovely chair.
I guess it can work when harassing people at design conventions isn’t an option.
